alert.note: Alert for Grant; Kay (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 29 at 10:42PM CDT until April 29 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1100 PM CDT FOR KAY AND EASTERN GRANT COUNTIES... At 1040 PM CDT, a line of severe thunderstorms extended from the Kansas state line northeast of Renfrow, southwest toward Pond Creek. The most severe storm was located 3 miles northwest of Lamont. The storms were moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Blackwell, Tonkawa, Medford, Newkirk, Lamont, Braman, Deer Creek, Jefferson, Renfrow, Chilocco, Nardin, Blackwell Lake and Peckham. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
